messages.message:
Is anyone getting this error message when running `make build`

```python /Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../..//shared-utils/build-utils/shared/src/py/copy_py_deps.py \
                --file /Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pydeps.txt \
                --thrift_file /Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pythriftdeps.txt \
                --proto_deps_file /Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/protodeps.txt \
                --build_path /Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/py/ \
                --project_dir /Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../../ \
                --skip_pygen=false
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../..//shared-utils/build-utils/shared/src/py/copy_py_deps.py", line 160, in <module>
    main()
  File "/Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../..//shared-utils/build-utils/shared/src/py/copy_py_deps.py", line 155, in main
    helper.build_thrift(thrift_deps_file, skip_pygen)
  File "/Users/victorzeng/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../..//shared-utils/build-utils/shared/src/py/copy_py_deps.py", line 84, in build_thrift
    stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
  File "/Users/victorzeng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.13/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 800, in __init__
    restore_signals, start_new_session)
  File "/Users/victorzeng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.13/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 1551, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename)
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'thrift': 'thrift'
make: *** [copy-py-deps] Error 1```

hmm, not sure, it looks to run fine on my side:
```xicheng@xis-macbook-pro system-tests % make build
mkdir -p /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/py
rm -f /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pydeps.txt
rm -f /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pythriftdeps.txt
rm -f /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/protodeps.txt
/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin/make -s list-deps >> /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pydeps.txt
/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin/make -s list-thrift-deps >> /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pythriftdeps.txt
/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin/make -s list-proto-deps >> /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/protodeps.txt
cp -r /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../..//shared-utils/py-utils/thrift-utils/types/src/py/* \
	    /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/py
python /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../..//shared-utils/build-utils/shared/src/py/copy_py_deps.py \
		--file /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pydeps.txt \
		--thrift_file /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/pythriftdeps.txt \
		--proto_deps_file /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/protodeps.txt \
		--build_path /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/py/ \
		--project_dir /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/../../../ \
		--skip_pygen=false
rsync -auh /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/src/py/* /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/py
cp -r /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/src/py/instabase_test/data /Users/xicheng/Dev/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-tests/build/py/instabase_test/```
A reboot fixed it. Iâ€™m guessing that the MacOS update pushed over the weekend messed up my system somehow.
